Against Chrome - A Manifesto

Great blog post by Steven Poole lashing out against virtual visual clutter in modern UI.

I disagree on his critisim of the iPad's iBooks reader though, while it is always in a perpetual middle of the book state, it fades to the background rather quickly when you get absorbed into the actual book itself. Additionally, if you find yourself nit-picking the tiniest details of the software your using then the designers got all the huge important stuff right.

A bit extreme, but I enjoyed the post thoroughly.
